body.p: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, written by Roald Dahl, is a long-standing, popular children’s book. It was first published in 1964 and has since been made into three movies and a musical.
It follows the story of a poor young boy who wins a coveted golden ticket to tour Willy Wonka’s mysterious and magical chocolate factory.
The theme of the story is “actions have consequences” which he depicts in a dark yet lively nature.
The theme of the story is “actions have consequences” which is an important lesson for kids to learn.
